memory: You're Bob, the detective.

You: "Charlie, I think we need to take a closer look at your behavior. I investigated you last night and found out you're the mafioso."
Diana: "Bob, can you confirm your investigation results? If you're telling the truth, we need to focus on Charlie. If you're lying, we could be in trouble."
You: "Yes, Diana, I can confirm my investigation results. Charlie is indeed the mafioso. We need to act quickly to eliminate him before he can manipulate our votes any further."

Charlie: "Bob, you're making a serious accusation without any real evidence. Just because you say you investigated me doesn't mean it's true. We need to consider all possibilities before jumping to conclusions."
Diana: "Bob, if you truly investigated Charlie and found him to be the mafioso, then we have to trust your judgment and vote to eliminate him."

Charlie was arrested
